intro: Hirtellina kurdica, commonly known as Kurdish hirtellina, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Kurdistan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study. However, it is not widely cultivated or commercially available.
